com.link_intersystems.lang.reflect

Class MethodInvokingTransformer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.link_intersystems.lang.reflect.MethodInvokingTransformer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Function<Object,Object>

    public class MethodInvokingTransformer
extends Object
implements Function<Object,Object>
    A MethodInvokingTransformer transforms objects by calling methods on them and returns the method result as the transformed object.
    Version:
    1.0.0;
    Author:
    Ren√© Link [rene.link@link- intersystems.com]

    • Method Detail

      • apply

        public Object apply(Object targetObject)

        The transformation logic is defined as:

        1. if the input is null than null is returned
        2. if the input is not an instance of the type this MethodInvokingTransformer transforms (see constructor argument type) than the input is passed through.
        3. otherwise the input is transformed by calling the transform method as defined by the constructor with the arguments that are resolved by the InvocationArgumentsResolver passed to the constructor and returning the methods result as the transformed object.

        Specified by:
        apply in interface Function<Object,Object>
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if an exception occurs while invoking the transform method on the input object.
        Since:
        1.0.0;
